item.title: Links: More PyPy, Academia, Censorship we Love, and Monads
item.dc:creator: Michael McCracken
item.description:
My shared links for March 1st through March 5th:

  • python - Does PyPY translate itself? - Stack Overflow - An informative answer about how PyPy works

  • On reviewing research papers Â« Lars Bergstrom - So, PL has a culture of really useful reviews, huh?

  • How to Do What You Love - "If you think something's supposed to hurt, you're less likely to notice if you're doing it wrong. That about sums up my experience of graduate school."

Boom!

  • The Millions : Ban This Book: An Uncensored Look At The Lorax And Other Dangerous Books -

  • A Neighborhood of Infinity: You Could Have Invented Monads! (And Maybe You Already Have.) - A practical way of thinking about monads.

item.title: Links for July 11th
item.dc:creator: Michael McCracken
item.description:
My shared links for July 11th:

  • Hacker News | I have some questions:* Is the Jit in PyPy standalone, i.e. can it be used by ot... - Questions and answers about the state of pypy and other related projects, in this HN thread.

  • Alex Gaynor -- So you want to write a fast Python? - Basically, a history of pypy, which was a lot of work. I'm lacking the context though - are there still people who want to start from scratch here? I thought UnladenSwallow was the last of those.
